1.q_string: Two circular coils can be arranged in any of the three orientations shown below. Their mutual inductance will be:

A rod CD connects the two wires. The power spent to slide the rod CD with a velocity v along the wires is (neglect the resistance of the wires and that of the rod):

An airplane, with \(20 m\) wingspread, is flying at \(250 ms ^{-1}\) parallel to the Earth's surface at a place where the horizontal component of Earth's magnetic field is \(2 \times 10^{-5} T\) and angle of dip is \(60^{\circ}\). The magnitude of the induced emf between the tips of the wings is:
In a coil, the current changes from 4A to 2A in 0.05 sec. If the induced e.m.f. is 8 volt, then self-inductance of the coil is:

Which of the following law states that “whenever the magnetic flux linked with a conductor or coil changes, an emf is induced in it?
The figure below shows two coils placed close to each other. When the current through one coil is decreased gradually by shifting the position of the rheostat, then:
q_option: Current flows along ABC in the other coil
Current flows along CBA in the other coil
No current flows in the other coil
An alternating current flows in the other coil

1.q_string: A coil and a magnet are moved in the same direction and with same speed. What will happen?
q_option: Electric current will be induced in the coil
Electric current will not be induced in the coil

(i) speedly

(ii) slowly

then the induced e.m.f./induced charge will be respectively_______.

(a) A magnet is moved towards the coil

(b) A magnet is moved away from the coil

Which of the following is CORRECT?
q_option: a, b and c all are correct

1.q_string: According to Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction, an emf is induced in a conductor whenever it:
q_option: Moves parallel to the direction of magnetic field

1.q_string: A square loop ABCD of side 'l' is placed in a perpendicular magnetic field of intensity B. The resistance of the side AB is R and the resistance of the other three sides is negligible. If the side AB is moved towards its opposite side with velocity v, then the force on the side AB will be:

A square loop ABCD is placed in a uniform magnetic field. The magnetic field is perpendicular to the plane of the loop. The resistance of the side AB is R and the resistance of the other three sides is negligible. If the side AB is moved towards its opposite side, then the power required to move the side AB proportional to the:

A rectangular loop PQRS is placed perpendicular in the uniform magnetic field of intensity 0.8 T and the arm PQ can move towards or away from the arm RS. Only the arm PQ possesses substantial resistance of 10 Ω and the length of the arm PQ is 1 m. Find the force required to push the arm PQ with velocity 10 cm/sec towards the arm RS.

The ratio of the side of the two square loop ABCD and PQRS is 1 : 2. The ratio of the resistance of the arm AB to arm PQ is 2 : 1 and the resistance of the other arms is negligible. Both the loops are placed perpendicular in the same magnetic field of intensity B. Find the ratio of the heat dissipated in the loop ABCD to the loop PQRS when the arms AB and PQ are moved towards their opposite arm with same speed.

A rectangular loop ABCD is placed in a perpendicular magnetic field of intensity B. The resistance of the sides BC, CD, and DA are negligible. When the side AB is moved towards its opposite side with velocity v, the heat generated in the loop is 100 Joule. If the velocity of the side AB is doubled, then the heat generated in the loop will be:

A rectangular loop PQRS is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.5 T. The field is directed perpendicular to the plane of the loop. Only the arm PQ possesses substantial resistance of 10 Ω. When the arm PQ of length 40 cm is moved with a velocity 10 m/sec as shown in the figure, calculate the induced current in the loop.

A square loop ABCD is placed in a uniform magnetic field of intensity B such that the direction of the field is perpendicular to the plane of the loop. The resistance of the side AB is R and the resistance of the other three sides is negligible. If the side AB of length 'l' is moved towards its opposite side with velocity v, then the heat generated in the loop is:

A square loop ABCD is placed in a uniform magnetic field such that the direction of the field is perpendicular to the plane of the loop. If the side AB is moved towards its opposite side, then the electric current produced in it due to:

A rectangular loop MNOP is placed in a uniform magnetic field of 0.6 T. The field is directed perpendicular to the plane of the loop. Only the arm MN of length 20 cm possesses substantial resistance of 5 Ω. Calculate the power required to move the arm MN towards the arm OP with a constant velocity 50 m/sec.
